meanings.definition: To act together or in conjunction with another
meanings.sent1: The students were coacting on the group project.
meanings.sent2: The team members were coacting to solve the problem efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were coacting to surprise their parents with a homemade dinner.
meanings.sent4: The dancers were coacting seamlessly, creating a mesmerizing performance.
meanings.sent5: The birds were coacting to build a nest, each bringing a different material.

meanings.definition: Working together towards a common goal
meanings.sent1: The coacting of the employees led to the success of the company.
meanings.sent2: The coacting of the community members made the event a great success.
meanings.sent3: The coacting of the animals in the forest was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The coacting of the musicians filled the concert hall with beautiful music.
meanings.sent5: The coacting of the ants in building their nest was fascinating to watch.
